pull.title: Fix symbol visibility issues, add test for it

repo.name: secp256k1
repo.description: Optimized C library for EC operations on curve secp256k1

repo.name: secp256k1

events.body: Rebased on top of the merged #1356.

Rebased f8167296935958e1c7a65654de8c6606959e9f3f -> d7b1ceaa834d00709dc1206be6dbd65428513ef2 ([pr1359.02](https://github.com/hebasto/secp256k1/commits/pr1359.02) -> [pr1359.03](https://github.com/hebasto/secp256k1/commits/pr1359.03)) due to the conflict with #1313.

@maflcko 

Is it possible for a Cirrus persistent worker to do not override environment variables set with the `ENV` command in the Dockerfile?

https://github.com/bitcoin-core/secp256k1/pull/1595#issue-2484933271:
> This reminds me that we should move forward with #1359.

Agreed.

Rebased and ready to move forward :)

Introduce `SECP256K1_LOCAL_VAR` macro

This change makes the `-fvisibility=hidden` compiler option unnecessary.

events.message:
Introduce `SECP256K1_LOCAL_VAR` macro

This change makes the `-fvisibility=hidden` compiler option unnecessary.
